text.name: sys_description
text.text: SuperGrafx is a video game console manufactured by NEC Corporation and launched in December 1989 in Japan. This is an improved version of the PC-Engine (CoreGrafX). It keeps the same processor at 8Mhz, but adds four times more memory. As well as a second video chip with its own memory and a controller to combine them in different ways. The maximum resolution is 512x242 (games use 256x242) in 126 colors out of 512 and the sound remains in 6 stereo voices. Only 5 games will be released on this medium, including Ghouls'n Ghosts and 1941 Counter Attack.
